name: shiori
description: Shiori is a self-hosted bookmark manager inspired by Pocket. It can be used via CLI or web UI, saving pages, snapshots, and tags while providing import/export features.
features: Bookmark management: Save web pages with titles, descriptions, and tags for organization.
Page archiving: Creates offline snapshots of bookmarked pages for permanent access.
Full-text search: Finds bookmarks by searching titles, content, tags, or URLs.
Tag organization: Categorizes bookmarks with multiple tags for flexible filtering.
CLI and web UI: Manage bookmarks via command line or modern web interface.
Import and export: Migrates bookmarks from browsers using standard HTML format.
Portable storage: Stores all data in a single SQLite database file for easy backup.
Reader mode: Displays saved pages in clean, distraction-free reading view.
Multi-user support: Creates separate accounts with individual bookmark collections.
Browser extensions: Quick-save bookmarks from Chrome and Firefox with official extensions.
REST API: Automates bookmark management and integrates with other tools.
Thumbnail generation: Automatically captures page screenshots for visual identification.
